Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 2-3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverite55
Reviews.Content: This straight-forward, "traditional" -[probably into its 2nd century,] ideally located central hotel had a February 2012 room rate of 320pesos for a small French-balconied double with a glimpse of the Metropolitan Cathedral two blocks away. [singles and interior, ie., no view, even less expensive] The rooms we looked in on, [two in addition to the one we stayed in] are small, with just enough room for two persons to negotiate comfortably for a short stay to take in the major sights near the Zocalo. The Rioja fronts on a major city-centre street, Cinco de Mayo, which is on the self-directed walking tours listed in the free tourist maps given out at the closest corner of the Cathedral. On previous, longer stays in Mexico City we'd stayed in much tonier hotels with larger rooms, and had we stayed a third night at the Rioja I would have started to feel the difference, I'm sure, but the location and price were ideal for our purposes this stay in D.F.; a viewing of painter Diego Rivera's Murals in three locations within walking distance-the Museo Mural Diego Rivera, the mural in Bellas Artes and the 250+ murals in the buildings of the Federal Sectretariat of Public Education. Over the time we were there [three weekdays/two nights] we saw older tourists like ourselves, young solo backpackers and Mexican businessmen in suits walking through the lobby. The value offered by the Rioja obviously appeals to a broad spectrum of travellers. The streets quieted down after rush hour, and stayed that way until 6 in the morning when Cinco de Mayo wakes for its working day. The woman at Rioja's front desk was wonderfully patient with my halting Spanish, and the bell-boy was able to help out with his try at English, but a better comfort level in Spanish on my part would have been helpful. Wi-fi in the lobby, a 30" flat screen in the room, and bottled water were part of the deal, and the only evident downside was that the towels appeared to have been boiled and bleached a couple of years too often!! Three doors east towards the Zocalo is a great fresh fruit bar called Jugos Canada, where 37pesos will get you a large choice of combinations starting with 6 fresh squeezed oranges, guava, banana and honey, or if you prefer a "Vampiro" blended beets celery and carrot.. --Quiet at 8am but crowded at noon-- We had planned to visit well-thought-of Restaurant El Popular across the street, but were distracted by the large portioned fare at Restarant La Capillia [associated with Hotel Gillow at the intersection to the west] for a lunch, then breakfast and dinner the following day. Previous good reviews on the TA site brought the Roja to our attention...I add my voice to the chorus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find close to the Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: painai2
Reviews.Content: I would stay no where else in Mexico City. I've stayed at the Rioja many, many times. Staff is very friendly. They always remember me. Perfect location, very near the Zocalo. The price is unbelievable. Rooms clean, bathrooms sparkle. If you need a taxi for the airport, the front desk can arrange it for you. If you don't speak Spanish, I suppose you should stay elsewhere (and pay more money). Across the street is a great Mexican Restaurant, El Popular. There is a computer in the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “REGULAR AMERICAN ARCHAEOLOGIST IN MEXICO”
Reviews.Author: karllorenzen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rioja since 1993 and have LOVED it ever since. You must be a discerning customer, not frivolous, just open to a clean, inexpensive, safe room, close to the Zocolo, in the Centro Historico, and based in the prefect location to check out what Mexico City has to offer. If you are prissy, indulgent, or privileged...this is NOT the place for you. However, if you want to see Mexico as a Mexican, this place IS IT. The Hotel Staff are courteous (but do not speak English), the rooms are clean and simple, and best of all - you're within walking distance of the Templo Mayor, Zocalo, Bellas Artes, Alemeda Park, Mexican Art Museum, etc. - no better place! If you want a US Hotel...do not stay here and go to the Zona Rosa, San Angel, Polanco, and other areas of D.F. that cater to rich clientele. Best regards from a seasoned archaeologist with experience in Mexico over 2 decades....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, centrally located hotel near to the Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: AarniH
Reviews.Content: Cheap, 250pesos for single, and 290pesos for double on room with window, rooms with no windows are cheaper. Rooms and public spaces were clean and in good condition. Offers free wifi, but does only work in lobby. There is also one computer with internet available on the lobby, 10pesos/20mins. Rooms with window/french balcony can be noisy during the day, but during week nights noise level is ok for sleeping. During the weekend there is an night club near, and you can hear clearly what song they are playing, even when balcony door is closed. Staff are friendly, but they do not speak english very well Location is great, few minutes to the Zocalo, museums, nightlife and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, my always Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinjax
Reviews.Content: On my 2nd visit after 3 years, staff remembered me, I stayed for 2 weeks, room cleaned everyday, bedspread was changed twice, as a single woman, I felt absolutly safe, had wake-up call every morning, very gently. Next time I would bring my own light bulb, higher wattage needed for late night reading. Lobby has pay-internet service, Hotel owner on site, professional staff, in-room safe, airport driver arranged, came at 5am as promised. This is my forever Hotel in Mexico City. lola F.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: MamaOcllo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night I arrived in Mexico City and the night before I left. Price was 230 pesos for a single room - very clean with hot water at all hours, bed very comfortable, TV included. The hotel is about two blocks from the Zocalo and the Cathedral, close enough to hear the bells but not loudly enough to keep you awake unless you're a very light sleeper. It looked to me as if most of the rooms, except those on the front of the building, have no exterior windows, with just windows in the double doors that open onto the walkways around the airwell. The staff were very helpful and cooperative. There's also what must be the world's smallest elevator - but it works just fine. I'd stay at the Rioja again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: bvoelker
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rioja is a fantastic bargain in a top notch location only 2 blocks from the Zocalo in Central Mexico City. It is a budget hotel and the rooms reflect this to some extent as they are a bit old with basic bathroom immenities. You will not have plush beds and robes in the closet. But for less than $20 US a night, it is excellent quality. Our room was very clean when we arrived and well cleaned every evening. When required, subway stations are less than 2 blocks away, making it very easy to get anywhere in the city. We stayed during the Independence celebration and were able to easily get back and forth to enjoy the festivities without worrying about subways or taxis. Also, the Independence Day parade comes right by the hotel and our window looking onto the street was a wonderful viewpoint to take it all in. A great experience at a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: samota_montreal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for what you pay. We were 3 nights at that hotel, having two double beds for three people. The room and the bathroom were clean. We liked the location of the hotel since it's very closed to the zocalo and to metro stations. There are many restaurants (in front of Cafe El Popular, good and cheap, open 24 h) and Seven-evelen stores near the hotel. People at the office were nice and helpful. The Internet access was 10 pesos / 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great price....”
Reviews.Author: jiimek
Reviews.Content: im professional tour guide, and i must say that this is the most luxury hotel for the lowest price ive ever been to....near to zocalo, bellas artes, torrelatinoamericana, my clients didnt have any problems to walk on their own nice rooms, clean bathroom, balcony with view, wi-fi, tv.....ive paid 230 pesos for room without balcony, i dont think its possible to find anything cheaper :) i highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: RitaR
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel with a great location, close to the Zocalo. Rooms are clean and comfortable, with modern tiled bathrooms, and fixtures and fittings of a quality you wouldnÂ´t expect at a price like this. We stayed for five nights in October, and paid 280 pesos for a double room overlooking the street. There was traffic noise - the windows arenÂ´t double glazed - but it didnÂ´t keep us awake. Service at the front desk could be a little gruff, but was very efficient. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location”
Reviews.Author: travel-more-pay-less
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel and would highly recommend it. Two people, two beds, balcony onto the street, 340 pesos (approx $35). We didn't make a reservation in advance but unless you're there for some special event, it looked like they're large enough that they always have rooms available. The location is excellent -- easy walking to the zocolo and Belles Artes, and only a couple of minutes from Allende metro station (we went everywhere by metro, very clean, safe and cheap.) We'd read on this site that the staff are unfriendly, but we found that by smiling and saying buenos dias everyday, they were very friendly and helpful. Great places to eat and snack all around. Only reason you might not like this hotel is if you get an exterior room, there is a lot of traffic noise from the street. Like many Mexican hotels, many of the rooms are interior, which means no street to the window. Those would probably be much quieter. Since August weather is ideal, no need for A/C, so can't speak to that. Shower was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMandeel
Reviews.Content: The room was OK, although the balcony opened onto a very noisy street and during the night we got terribly mosquito-bitten. We had to leave the balcony open because there is no AC and no fan. However, that evening the receptionist charged me $5 for an extra guest in the room ( invited my student to stay with us instead of returning home on the subway at night) and didn't give me a receipt. When we returned after dinner, there was a different receptionist who denied any knowledge of my previous payment. In fact, he was very accusatory and unpleasant, wouldn't give me the name of the manager or call the previous receptionist. He wouldn't even give me HIS name, so I could write a complaint to the management. I ended up having to call the tourist police to get his name-- a whole ugly ending to our stay. We left a letter of complaint, which was never addressed and never replied to. If you go to the Rioja, don't trust ANYBODY. Get a receipt for everything, and don't be afraid to get nasty for your rights.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: phuyen
Reviews.Content: It is nicely renovated for a budget hotel. I stay there for 2 nts but after the second day, I decided to checkout because I could not stand the staff any longer at the Riojas . This hotel has the most unfreindly and rude staff I have ever experienced for a long while. If you are simply looking for a place to sleep with clean facilities then this is not a bad place. However, if you care, at all, about a friendly atmosphere where the they will greet and smile then be prepared for a disappointment. Particularly, the lady receptionist on day-shift. The staff at the Rioja Hotel seems to believe that they are their to do you a favor. They do not see themselves in a position of customer service. Their attitude is that, there are many other customers to replace you because of the low place they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: katievic
Reviews.Content: After running around Mexico City trying to find a double room in all the hostels with no luck, we found this place in the guide book under budget stays. We walked into a nice lobby area and were both thinking "this doesn't look very budget". Asked the woman at the desk how much for a double room per night and she said 250 pesos.......we asked per person? and she told us, no altogether! it was cheaper than some of the hostels! we had a tv, ensuite and it got cleaned everyday. it's right in the centro historico, near the plaza. Stayed here for a week and we were so happy with it. Ask at reception for laundry services. One of the best finds of my trip in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mariabythesea
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rioja is truly a bargain. I stayed there with my mother during the November holidays. Our room had two double beds, cable and a nice balcony onto 5 de Mayo for less than 350 pesos. The room was impeccable and the staff was extremely courteous. The hotel is located next to great restaurants, bars, the metro and the Zocalo. The only downside is that Hotel Rioja does not take reservations - first come first serve.

Reviews.Title: “handy location, quiet, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CatFrank
Reviews.Content: I was a walk in to Hotel Rioja on Avenida 5 de Mayo. I stayed here for about a week in October 2006 and it cost me MX$230 a night. I had a room on the top floor. It had a good sized clean & modern bathroom (great shower!) & the room was spacious enough with a double bed. I was travelling alone so the size of the room was perfect for me, but for couples it may seem too small. The hotel was very quiet, clean & comfortable and I will definitely stay here again when next I am in Mexico City. The owners were very friendly and helpful & as a sole-female traveller I felt very safe. The only drawback for me (as I travelled with a laptop) was there was no wireless internet connection, but there are a few internet cafes within walking distance. The other downside was that there were no laundry facilities, but after speaking with the concierge he put me in touch with a maid who washed my clothes for me for about MX$100. The Hotel is in the Centro HistÃ³rico and a very short walk to the zÃ³calo. I highly recommend this Hotel.
